prompt.content: What were the primary sources of synergies for Expand Energy Corp (NASDAQ: EXE)'s merger with Southwestern Energy, and how have the projected synergies changed over time since the announcement of the merger?

messages.content: [{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Originally announced annual synergy target of approximately $400 M (run-rate)"},{"criteria":"Most recent October 2025 guidance update increased the annual synergy outlook to $600 M by the end of FY 2026","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Most recent October 2025 guidance indicated the deal was on track to hit $500 M in annual synergies by the end of FY 2025"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Primary synergy sources includes: lower drilling and completion costs"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Primary synergy sources includes: G&A reductions"},{"criteria":"Primary synergy sources includes: utilization of shared operational infrastructure","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Primary synergy sources includes: longer laterals"}]
